markdownRemark.html:
I recently upgraded richsoni.com to Gatsby version 2.0, read about it in this previous post. I was under the assumption that this would cure all my typescript woes, based on the release notes for Gatsby 2. However, to my disappointment, this was not the case.

It took a bit of research, and some elbow grease to get my build to behave as I would expect it. However, after some tribulation, it is now working the way I want it to.

Rename A JS file to Typescript

The first thing I did was rename a file, src/util/data.js, to src/util/data.tsx.

export const eventsWithSetlist = (events) => {
  return events
    .edges
    .map((e) => e.node)
    .filter((e) => e.frontmatter.setlist)
};

export const eventsBySong = (events, songs) => {
  return eventsWithSetlist(events)
  .reduce((songs, event) => {
    (event.frontmatter.setlist || []).map((song) => {
      if(!songs[song]) { songs[song] = [] }
      songs[song].push(event.fields.date)
    });
    return songs;
  }, {});
}

export const eventsWithSong = (events, song) => {
  return events
    .edges
    .filter((event) => event.node.frontmatter.setlist)
    .filter((event) => event.node.frontmatter.setlist.includes(song));
}

export const nodesByBasename = (collection) => {
  return collection.edges.map((e) => e.node).reduce((nodesByBasename, node) => {
    return {...nodesByBasename,
      [node.fields.basename]: node,
    };
  }, {})
};

I chose this file because it has no dependencies, and it is small. My reasoning was that this would minimize the variables to examine, and prove that typescript is indeed supported.

After running gatsby develop, I was faced with an error:

ERROR in ./src/templates/songs.js
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '../utils/data' in 'src/templates'

Adding Typescript

While not documented anywhere, it seems that gatsby-plugin-typescript, only supports Gatsby 2, but is required for typescript support. I found only hints at this on sites like this one.

I decided to give installing gatsby-plugin-typescript a shot:

$ yarn add gatsby-plugin-typescript

This still gave me the same error:

ERROR in ./src/templates/songs.js
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '../utils/data' in 'src/templates'

I read throught the page for the plugin some more, and made a few more changes.

First, I added some options to the gatsby-config.

$ git diff gatsby-config.js
+    resolve: `gatsby-plugin-typescript`,
+    options: {
+      isTSX: true,
+      allExtensions: true,
+    }
+  },

I also, added the npm command to run the type-check:

git diff package.json
-    "deploy": "gh-pages-clean && gatsby build --prefix-paths && gh-pages -b master -d public -r https://github.com/richsoni/richsoni.github.io.git"
+    "deploy": "gh-pages-clean && gatsby build --prefix-paths && gh-pages -b master -d public -r https://github.com/richsoni/richsoni.github.io.git",
+    "type-check": "tsc --noEmit",

However, I still got the same error:

ERROR in ./src/templates/songs.js
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '../utils/data' in 'src/templates'

I thought it might be because my typescript is broken, so I ran $ yarn type-check, to see if there where any errors:

$ yarn type-check
yarn run v1.12.3
$ tsc --noEmit
/bin/sh: tsc: command not found

The error, alluded that I am missing the typescript package, which comes with an executable command tsc. I added typescript.

$ yarn add typescript
